prompt.stem: A ball is thrown vertically upwards and returns to its original position. Neglecting air resistance, which displacement‑time (s-t) graph represents its motion?

level1: Recall that the gradient of an s–t graph is velocity.
level2: Velocity decreases linearly to zero at the top, then increases in magnitude downward; so s–t must be a concave-down parabola returning to the start.

level3.content: s–t gradient = v; acceleration is constant and negative (−g).
Constant negative acceleration → s–t is a downward-opening parabola with a turning point at maximum height.
Select the graph that rises, flattens to zero gradient at the top, then returns symmetrically to the start (option A).

common_errors: Choosing a graph with constant gradient (constant velocity)
Confusing s–t with v–t or a–t graphs
